channel.title: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?
channel.description: my school blocked a lot of websites,even ones that arent offensive like google.is there a way to change the blocks so that i could go to other sites that the school blocked?and if there is a way can someone post it here?

item.title: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?
item.dc:creator: @Cheatest Cheatest
item.description:
@Cheatest wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Try firefox. My school uses symantec, and doesnt block firefox. But theres a WLAN firewall that blocks firefox also…which sucks.

your an idiot if sites are blocked you CANT DOWNLOAD…

This smart computer literate person i was talking to he was telling me about this…
Ive yet to try it so tell me if it works =)

Steps

1.Log into your username
2.pull out the eithernet cord from back of comp
3.SHUT DOWN not log off
4.log back on
5.plug it in

Because the computer would not of loaded the countys info he said it should work.

Read full topic

4)Start Crying.[/quote]

item.title: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?
item.dc:creator: @Swift Swift
item.description:
@Swift wrote:

Can:

If your school use Win95, Win98, WinMe, or Win2000, or WinXP. It is realy No problem at all. Just state what version you are using and i will reply with the proceedings.

School computers = Windows 98

Please reply They disabled right clicking, renaming, downloading, saving, and ctrl alt + del, ctrl shift + esc too.

Read full topic
item.source: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?

item.title: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

But on my schools system, synchroneyes tells the teacher which computer has which user logged on, and if someone does something like that, we’ll get screwed. Plus I know one of my teacher’s passwords. Its just his first name…cuz hes lazy.

Read full topic
item.source: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?

item.title: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

My school has individual logins for everyone but I found out last year that they have a guest account for the teachers or staff that isnt password protected and it has the same user rights as a normal student login. So whenever I need to do something without using my username I use the guest account

Read full topic
item.source: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?

item.title: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

My school uses WinXP, and we’ll get Vista the day it comes out for our 1000+ computers, I can tell you that.
We used desktop authority, remote desktop, and the shutdown function on cmd, but we got suspended because of that. Our tech guys arent retarded. All our teachers have synchroneyes now, so we cant do shit, and we have to log in on our own name. I doubt you could find a way past the symantec and wlan firewalls our school has, while disabling synchroneyes.

Read full topic
item.source: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?

item.title: R u able to get passed schools computer blocks?
item.dc:creator: @Can Can
item.description:
@Can wrote:

If your school use Win95, Win98, WinMe, or Win2000, or WinXP. It is realy No problem at all. Just state what version you are using and i will reply with the proceedings.

If you use Mac however, Precumingly OsX, you have a hard time getting that pass. On my old school i had to be the school boards sweet pets, making the school webpage, programming games and applications etc before we were granted, as the only 3 people on the school with 800+ pupils, the admin key.

Ow we had much fun with that key

Remote desktop on the North-Europs biggest mac network… Phew, I can tell you we some good fun.

It even worked when our Macs were in Exam mode for the final exams…

Read full topic
